main.enactingFormula: (Made by the Chief Executive in Council under section 2 of the Emergency Regulations Ordinance (Cap. 241))

section.name: s1
section.heading: Commencement
section.content: This Regulation comes into operation on 5 October 2019.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: Cap. 245 (《公安條例》) means the Public Order Ordinance (Cap. 245);
facial covering (蒙面物品) means a mask or any other article of any kind (including paint) that covers all or part of a person’s face;
police officer (警務人員) has the meaning given by section 3 of the Police Force Ordinance (Cap. 232);
unauthorized assembly (未經批准集結) has the same meaning as in section 17A(2) of Cap. 245;
unlawful assembly (非法集結) has the same meaning as in section 18 of Cap. 245.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Use of facial covering in certain circumstances is an offence

subsection.leadIn: A person must not use any facial covering that is likely to prevent identification while the person is at—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an unlawful assembly (whether or not the assembly is a riot within the meaning of section 19 of Cap. 245);

subparagraph.content: takes place under section 7(1) of Cap. 245; and
does not fall within paragraph (a) or (b); or
takes place under section 13(1) of Cap. 245; and
does not fall within paragraph (a) or (b).

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 1 year.

It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under section 3(2) to establish that, at the time of the alleged offence, the person had lawful authority or reasonable excuse for using a facial covering.

subsection.leadIn: A person is taken to have established that the person had lawful authority or reasonable excuse for using a facial covering if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is sufficient evidence to raise an issue that the person had such lawful authority or reasonable excuse; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the contrary is not proved by the prosecution beyond reasonable doubt.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting the scope of the reasonable excuse referred to in subsection (1), a person had a reasonable excuse if, at the assembly, meeting or procession concerned—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person was engaged in a profession or employment and was using the facial covering for the physical safety of the person while performing an act or activity connected with the profession or employment;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person was using the facial covering for religious reasons; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the person was using the facial covering for a pre-existing medical or health reason.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Power to require removal in public place of facial covering

subsection.content: This section applies in relation to a person in a public place who is using a facial covering that a police officer reasonably believes is likely to prevent identification.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: stop the person and require the person to remove the facial covering to enable the officer to verify the identity of the person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the person fails to comply with a requirement under paragraph (a)—remove the facial covering.

subsection.content: A person who fails to comply with a requirement under subsection (2)(a) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Prosecution deadline for offences
section.content: A prosecution for an offence under section 3(2) or 5(3) may only be started before the end of 12 months beginning on the date on which the offence is committed.
